intro: Pectinaria longipes subsp. longipes, commonly known as the longipes spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. The plant produces a milky latex when the stems are broken, a common trait among members of its family. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky habitats. The subspecies longipes is noted for its elongated leaves and is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
